kou commented on pull request #6498: ARROW-7917: [C++] Find Python 3 in CMake configuration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6498#discussion_r385376889
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/FindPython3Alt.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,55 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+# This module finds the libraries corresponding to the Python 3 interpeter,
+# and sets the following variables:
+# - PYTHON_EXECUTABLE
+# - PYTHON_INCLUDE_DIRS
+# - PYTHON_LIBRARIES
+# - PYTHON_OTHER_LIBS
+
+# Need CMake 3.15 or later for Python3_FIND_STRATEGY
+if(${CMAKE_VERSION} VERSION_LESS "3.15.0")
+  # Use deprecated FindPythonInterp package
+  if(Python3Alt_FIND_REQUIRED)
+    find_package(PythonLibsNew REQUIRED)
+  else()
+    find_package(PythonLibsNew)
+  endif()
+  return()
+endif()
+
+if(Python3Alt_FIND_REQUIRED)
+  find_package(Python3 COMPONENTS Interpreter Development NumPy REQUIRED)
+else()
+  find_package(Python3 COMPONENTS Interpreter Development NumPy)
+endif()
+
 
 Review comment:
   We need to call `find_package_handle_standard_args()` here too.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #6498: ARROW-7917: [C++] Find Python 3 in CMake configuration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6498#discussion_r385376345
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/FindPython3Alt.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,55 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+# This module finds the libraries corresponding to the Python 3 interpeter,
+# and sets the following variables:
+# - PYTHON_EXECUTABLE
+# - PYTHON_INCLUDE_DIRS
+# - PYTHON_LIBRARIES
+# - PYTHON_OTHER_LIBS
+
+# Need CMake 3.15 or later for Python3_FIND_STRATEGY
+if(${CMAKE_VERSION} VERSION_LESS "3.15.0")
+  # Use deprecated FindPythonInterp package
+  if(Python3Alt_FIND_REQUIRED)
+    find_package(PythonLibsNew REQUIRED)
+  else()
+    find_package(PythonLibsNew)
+  endif()
+  return()
 
 Review comment:
   We need to set `${PACKAGE_NAME}_FOUND` in `Find${PACKAGE_NAME}.cmake`. (`Python3Alt_FOUND` in this case.)
   https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/manual/cmake-developer.7.html#find-modules
   We can do this by `find_package_handle_standard_args(Python3Alt REQUIRED_VARS PYTHON_LIBRARIES)`.
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #6498: ARROW-7917: [C++] Find Python 3 in CMake configuration
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6498#discussion_r385373398
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -19,7 +19,7 @@
 # arrow_python
 #
 
-find_package(PythonLibsNew REQUIRED)
+find_package(Python3Alt REQUIRED)
 find_package(NumPy REQUIRED)
 
 Review comment:
   How about we find NumPy in `FindPython3Alt.cmake` and don't call `find_package(NumPy REQUIRED)` here?
   Because `FindPython3.cmake` can find both Python3 and NumPy at once.  I think that `FindPython3Alt.cmake` should do so.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

 Review comment:

   Because `FindPython3.cmake` can find both Python3 and NumPy at once.  I think that `FindPython3Alt.cmake` should do so.
